page.title: 10THE PINETUM,HIGHNAM WOODS
page.content: The Highnam Pinetum was begun in 1844 by Thomas Gambier-Parry,at the age of 28.The chosen site faces south and light sandy soils provide good drainage and clay patches adding variety.By 1845 some 385 species were planted.The Pinetum and landscaped garden were also noted for wild flowers. Pinetum Lodge,once the gamekeeper's home is now occupied by Mr.J.D.Wilkin who has begun the task of restoring this neglected attraction.An MSC community programme has undertaken clearing fallen timber,rebuilding paths and bridges and most importantly replanting amongst the mature trees to restore the 13 acres to its former glory.The public approach is by footpath from Two-mile lane at G.R. 79101966.
